H0.text: Sodium is the element best able to combine with itself and hydrogen [H] to form large molecules.

H1.text: Lithium [Li] is the element best able to combine with itself and hydrogen [H] to form large molecules.

H2.text: Sulfur is the element best able to combine with itself and hydrogen to form large molecules.

H3.text: Carbon [C] is the element that best combines with itself and hydrogen [H] to form large molecules.

A4.text: Carbon's abundance, its unique diversity of organic compounds, and its unusual ability to form polymers at the temperatures commonly encountered on Earth, enables this element to serve as a common element of all known life.

A5.text: The atoms of carbon can bond together in diverse ways, resulting in various allotropes of carbon.
